Module JTrashFX
Package application.controller

Class HomeController

java.lang.Object
application.controller.HomeController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class HomeController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is used to control the view of the Home page
Author:
Luigi Pennisi

    Method
    Description
    void
    changeAvatar()
    This method opens an file picker windows to permit the user to select an image to set as avatar.
    void
    chiudiTutto()
    This method terminates the execution of the application saving first
    void
    clickSound()
    This method is called when clicking on a button, it reproduce the click sound
    void
    deleteProfile()
    This method delete the user's account going back in the login window resetting the model first
    void
    discard()
    This method discard the current card on the table which can be the just drawn card or the switched one, and after to have discarded it
    void
    discard(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
    This is the discard method invoked by clicking on the discard button so from the user
    void
    disconnect()
    This method log out the user going back in the login window saving and resetting the model first

    This method shows an Object got as input in the allertBox label in the middle of the screen (above the deck) applying the Fade Transition
    private void
    fadeEffect(String text, javafx.util.Duration time, double opacityStart, double opacityEnd, boolean reverse, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> onFinish)
    This method shows a String got as input in the allertBox label in the middle of the screen (above the deck) applying the Fade Transition
    private int
    getCardImageViewPosition(javafx.scene.image.ImageView card, int n)
    This method returns the number of the card by his ImageView's Id
    Player
    getFollowingPlayer()
    This method return the next player available in anti hour sense
    private javafx.scene.image.ImageView[]
    getHandImages(Player p)
    This method return the array of ImageView that represent the hand of a player
    static HomeController
    getInstance()
    getter of the instance, the instance will not be created if null, to work the HomeController has to be initialize trough the classic method.
    ArrayList<Player>
    getPlayers()
    getter of players
    private javafx.scene.image.ImageView
    getUserCardViewByPosition(String position)
    This method returns the ImageView of the player card on the position got as parameter.
    void
    initialize(URL arg0, ResourceBundle arg1)
    This is the method called when the linked view is launched, it's needed to initialize the dynamic fields
    void
    leaveGame()
    This method delete the ongoing game considering the player loser so update his statistics and switch back to the npc selector view.
    private void
    nextRound()
    This method reset the cards on the table , mix the deck and distribute the new cards to the players simulating so a new round
    private void
    npcPlay()
    This method checks if the card to play is switchable with one of the npc, if it can be switched it invoke the method to switch the cards else it discard it and pass the turn
    void
    npcSelection(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
    This method works when the checks box to choose the number of npc are selected, the method remove the selection on the other checks box and set the variable selection = the clicked check box
    private void
    passToNextTurn()
    This method starts the turn for the following player showing that it's his turn and setting the action to do after the fade transition is over that is different if the player is the user or an npc.
    private void
    reloadAvatar()
    This method refresh the view of the avatar of the user
    void
    resetGame()
    This method is used to reset the game properties to be ready for a next one
    void
    sayTrash()
    This method is called when someone has trashed, if the player who trashed has won it ends the game else it advice that all the others players has one last turn to trash, this only if it's the first time in the round that this method is being called
    private void
    setAllHiddenCardsClickable()
    This method apply the clickableEffect on all cards that are still Hidden
    private void
    setCardOnMouseClickProperty(javafx.scene.Node JObj, boolean isClickable, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMouseClick)
    This method apply to the Node got in input an effect to inform that it can be clicked and the EventHandler also got as parameter if the boolean got is true, else it set the effect and the event to null
    private void
    setClickableEffect(javafx.scene.effect.Effect clickableEffect)
    This method sets the clickable Effect property
    private void
    setGameProperties(int n)
    This method initialize the array of player and the deck
    void
    setPlayers(int numOfNpc)
    This method set the property player which contain the instance of the player playing the session
    void
    showCardToPlay(javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> afterFading)
    This method show in the view the image of the current card to play.
    void
    startsPlay()
    This method starts the game: using the selection property it works only if a number of npc is selected.
    private void
    switchCard(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent cardClicked)
    This method switch the current card on the table(newC) with the clicked ImageView then it let the user turn go over
    private void
    updateStatsMenu()
    This Method refresh the view of the top Bar containing the player's info like the counts of the games and the level
    void
    userPlay()
    This method is invoked by the user in the view when he/she draws a card.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static HomeController getInstance()
      getter of the instance, the instance will not be created if null, to work the HomeController has to be initialize trough the classic method. This method is just a simple getter
      Returns:
      the static instance of HomeController

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL arg0, ResourceBundle arg1)
      This is the method called when the linked view is launched, it's needed to initialize the dynamic fields
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      This method is used to reset the game properties to be ready for a next one

      public void clickSound()
      This method is called when clicking on a button, it reproduce the click sound

      public void setPlayers(int numOfNpc)
      This method set the property player which contain the instance of the player playing the session
      Parameters:
      numOfNpc - the number of npc choosen

    • getPlayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
      getter of players
      Returns:
      the arrayList of players

    • getCardImageViewPosition

      private int getCardImageViewPosition(javafx.scene.image.ImageView card, int n)
      This method returns the number of the card by his ImageView's Id

      e.g -> Card's Id: "user1", n: 4 -> returns the 5' char that is "1" as Integer

      Parameters:
      card - Is the card from which return the position
      n - Is the number of chars in the ID before the number
      Returns:
      the integer that represent the position of the card in the hand

    • setClickableEffect

      private void setClickableEffect(javafx.scene.effect.Effect clickableEffect)
      This method sets the clickable Effect property

      Property Description: This variable of type Effect contain the effect that must have a clickable card to inform the user that it's clickable.

      Parameters:
      clickableEffect - is the Effect with which sets the property

    • fadeEffect

      private void fadeEffect(String text, javafx.util.Duration time, double opacityStart, double opacityEnd, boolean reverse, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> onFinish)
      This method shows a String got as input in the allertBox label in the middle of the screen (above the deck) applying the Fade Transition
      Parameters:
      text - Is the String with which sets the text of the allertBox in the center
      time - Is the time the transition must go on
      opacityStart - Is the opacity the node starts with
      opacityEnd - Is the opacity with which the node will end
      reverse - Is a boolean needed to indicate if the transition have to disappear fading in reverse
      onFinish - Is the EventHandler with which set the OnFinished Transition Property

    • fadeEffect

      private void fadeEffect(Object JObj, javafx.util.Duration time, double opacityStart, double opacityEnd, boolean reverse, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> onFinish)
      This method shows an Object got as input in the allertBox label in the middle of the screen (above the deck) applying the Fade Transition
      Parameters:
      JObj - Is the Object to downCast to Node and to show in the Transition
      time - Is the time the transition must go on
      opacityStart - Is the opacity the node starts with
      opacityEnd - Is the opacity with which the node will end
      reverse - Is a boolean needed to indicate if the transition have to disappear fading in reverse
      onFinish - Is the EventHandler with which set the OnFinished Transition Property

    • getUserCardViewByPosition

      private javafx.scene.image.ImageView getUserCardViewByPosition(String position)
      This method returns the ImageView of the player card on the position got as parameter. This is used to understand to which card substitute the card to play
      Parameters:
      position - The position of the card to return
      Returns:
      the ImageView of the card on the specified position

    • setCardOnMouseClickProperty

      private void setCardOnMouseClickProperty(javafx.scene.Node JObj, boolean isClickable, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMouseClick)
      This method apply to the Node got in input an effect to inform that it can be clicked and the EventHandler also got as parameter if the boolean got is true, else it set the effect and the event to null
      Parameters:
      JObj - Is the node on which set the effect
      isClickable - Is a boolean to know if apply or delete the effect
      onMouseClick - is the EventHandler to set as onMouseClick Action

    • setAllHiddenCardsClickable

      private void setAllHiddenCardsClickable()
      This method apply the clickableEffect on all cards that are still Hidden

    • getFollowingPlayer

      public Player getFollowingPlayer()
      This method return the next player available in anti hour sense
      Returns:
      the next player respect the current player

    • passToNextTurn

      private void passToNextTurn()
      This method starts the turn for the following player showing that it's his turn and setting the action to do after the fade transition is over that is different if the player is the user or an npc. If the next Player is a player who has already trashed it pass to the next round

    • nextRound

      private void nextRound()
      This method reset the cards on the table , mix the deck and distribute the new cards to the players simulating so a new round

    • getHandImages

      private javafx.scene.image.ImageView[] getHandImages(Player p)
      This method return the array of ImageView that represent the hand of a player
      Parameters:
      p - Is the player which will back the hand
      Returns:
      an ImageView[] who has the instance of the single cards of the player

    • updateStatsMenu

      private void updateStatsMenu()
      This Method refresh the view of the top Bar containing the player's info like the counts of the games and the level

    • changeAvatar

      public void changeAvatar()
      This method opens an file picker windows to permit the user to select an image to set as avatar. Only png and jpeg images are allowed

    • reloadAvatar

      private void reloadAvatar()
      This method refresh the view of the avatar of the user

    • chiudiTutto

      public void chiudiTutto()
      This method terminates the execution of the application saving first

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      This method log out the user going back in the login window saving and resetting the model first

    • deleteProfile

      public void deleteProfile()
      This method delete the user's account going back in the login window resetting the model first

    • leaveGame

      public void leaveGame()
      This method delete the ongoing game considering the player loser so update his statistics and switch back to the npc selector view.

    • sayTrash

      public void sayTrash()
      This method is called when someone has trashed, if the player who trashed has won it ends the game else it advice that all the others players has one last turn to trash, this only if it's the first time in the round that this method is being called

    • discard

      public void discard()
      This method discard the current card on the table which can be the just drawn card or the switched one, and after to have discarded it

    • discard

      public void discard(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      This is the discard method invoked by clicking on the discard button so from the user
      Parameters:
      e - ActionEvent

    • npcSelection

      public void npcSelection(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      This method works when the checks box to choose the number of npc are selected, the method remove the selection on the other checks box and set the variable selection = the clicked check box
      Parameters:
      e - Is the Node who invoked the event/method

    • startsPlay

      public void startsPlay()
      This method starts the game: using the selection property it works only if a number of npc is selected. Then ask the user the initial number of cards. Then depending on the number of npc choose it sets visible the hands of the npc Then initialize the Model with this number Then says to the Model to distribute the cards Then witch the view from the npc selection to the game table In the end able the player to play

    • setGameProperties

      private void setGameProperties(int n)
      This method initialize the array of player and the deck
      Parameters:
      n - is the number of npc

    • showCardToPlay

      public void showCardToPlay(javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> afterFading)
      This method show in the view the image of the current card to play. The card is drawn if not present (it's present if is a card switched)
      Parameters:
      afterFading - is the Event to run on the finish of the fade effect

    • userPlay

      public void userPlay()
      This method is invoked by the user in the view when he/she draws a card. The method invoke the method to show the current card to play and allow the user to choose the card to switch

    • switchCard

      private void switchCard(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent cardClicked)
      This method switch the current card on the table(newC) with the clicked ImageView then it let the user turn go over
      Parameters:
      cardClicked - Is the MouseEvent object on which the event has been invoked that is always an ImageView

    • npcPlay

      private void npcPlay()
      This method checks if the card to play is switchable with one of the npc, if it can be switched it invoke the method to switch the cards else it discard it and pass the turn
